member.name: T:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities
member.summary: Defines values that specify the attributes of an ink recognizer.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.None
member.summary: No capabilities specified.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.DoNotCare
member.summary: Ignores all other flags that are set.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.Object
member.summary: Supports object recognition; otherwise, recognizes only text.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.FreeInput
member.summary: Supports free input, where ink is entered without the use of a recognition guide, such as a line or a box.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.LinedInput
member.summary: Supports lined input, which is similar to writing on lined paper.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.BoxedInput
member.summary: Supports boxed input, where each character or word is entered in a box.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.CharacterAutoCompletionInput
member.summary: Supports character Autocomplete. Recognizers that support character Autocomplete require boxed input.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.RightAndDown
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in right and down order, such as in western languages and some East Asian languages.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.LeftAndDown
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in left and down order, such as in Hebrew and Arabic languages.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.DownAndLeft
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in down and left order, such as in some East Asian languages.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.DownAndRight
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in down and right order, such as in some East Asian languages.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.ArbitraryAngle
member.summary: Supports text written at arbitrary angles.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.Lattice
member.summary: Supports returning a object as an alternative to Stringhttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemstringclasstopic.asp for handwriting recognition results.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.AdviseInkChange
member.summary: Supports interrupting background recognition. For example, when the ink has changed.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.StrokeReorder
member.summary: Enforces stroke order, such as spatial and temporal, during a recognition operation. The does not reorder strokes before sending ink to the .

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.Personalizable
member.summary: Supports personalized handwriting, where the recognizer improves recognition when exposed to the same handwriting over time.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.PrefersArbitraryAngle
member.summary: Supports that the need not rotate the handwriting to a horizontal orientation before sending the ink to the .

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.PrefersParagraphBreaking
member.summary: Indicates that the should send entire paragraphs of ink to the , allowing the to do the Line breaking and Word (or character) breaking.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.PrefersSegmentationRecognition
member.summary: Indicates that the will send the individual ink words (or characters depending on the language) when recognizing, instead of sending entire lines of writing.
